item.title: Faster Than Life – Global Game Jam 2019 Project
item.description: Like in the previous year, I took part in the Global Game Jam. I joined a team of six programmers, unfortunately there was a shortage of artists this year. During the 48 hour jam, we made a space game that is inspired by Faster Than Light.

item.title: Infinite procedurally generated city with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm
item.description: This is a game where you walk through an infinite city that is procedurally generated as you walk. It is generated from a set of blocks with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm.

item.title: Agent V – Global Game Jam 2018 Project
Generating 3D roof meshes from aerial LIDAR data
item.description: This is my graduation project I did in computer science. The goal was to come up with a method to generate 3D meshes of building roofs from point cloud data. The point cloud data was taken with aerial LIDAR scanners and is available online. In addition, I used building layout polygons, which are also available as open data. I tested several strategies to generate a mesh and I’ll explain the best one in this post.
